laboratory_examinations.findings: Decreased 25(OH)D at 20 months of age (injection treatment at 300,000 IU), normalized with therapy.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Persistently decreased 25(OH)D levels noted, with improvement correlating with increased doses of 1,25(OH)2D.
Initially started at 0.25 µg/d at 24 months; dosage increased based on clinical response up to 5.0 µg/d resulting in normalization of intact PTH and alkaline phosphatase.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Elevated alkaline phosphatase observed at multiple time points (e.g., 466 U/l at 20 months).

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Normalized with appropriate treatment dosages over time.
Stable but required dosage adjustments based on treatment response.
Remaining within normal limits during evaluations.
Normalization efforts noted with phosphate supplementation, no benefit stated.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Decreased osteocalcin of 11 ng/ml; increased bone-specific alkaline phosphatase of 1049 U/l.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up evaluations indicated persistent abnormalities suggesting ongoing metabolic bone disease.
